revisionDesc.change: added key information for sender and recipient
Replace internal notes with external notes
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
revised header to move WWA staff names to respStmt; removed empty opener child elements; replaced wwa editorial notes with ptrs to external notes file.
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Replace straight quotes with smart quotes
Corrected from proofreading and corrected annotation on conflict with Jeff over visit to Hannah, corrected Hegamen annotation, expanded Jesse annotation with Roper.
checked; added brackets to dates in titlestmt and bibl

body.p:
i have not gone to burlington Burlington yet but if nothing occurs i shall go next monday Monday i have not felt able to go through the hot weather but as it is cooler now i think i can stand it i wish Walter you would write to hanna and tell her i will come on monday Monday next if nothing prevents George thinks he will go as far as troyTroy and then come for me when i return) which will be before very long george will go to mrs hegamensHegeman's to board and edd will stay here marthaMartha has very much to doodo she has been foolish enoughf enough to take 2 or 300 dozens of shirt fronts and she cant can't get them stichedstitched every girl is full of work so she and jeff Jeff has set up every night till midnight to work i think she will be perfectly satisfied when she gets this lot done to not take any more sis almost lives down here, she thinks very much of orgee as she calls her unkle uncle george George i suppose you got Jeffs Jeff's letter saying about George wanting to get in the custom house he would like to get in i suppose very much he and A man by the name of smithSmith has been talking of buying some lots and building A shop and 2 houses but he says that would not prevent him from going in the custom house if he could get the appointement appointment
he seems to feel as if he ought to be earning something i dont don't ask for but very little but he would give me if i asked for it i know. but i thing think he wants to doo do something with what money there is) of course you know Walt i wouldent wouldn't make any fuss about it he has earned it hard and it rightly belongs to him and if he can doo do better with taking i would rather he would if i only had some place to live i am very tired of living here it is very disagreable disagreeable in many ways Georg George thinks maybee maybe we can get some small house but rents is so very high well i gess guess i wont worry i dont don't believe i shall ever want i hope you will keep well walt i was glad to hear you boarded with mrs gracon i should think it would be much better) i have fixed up georges George's room and put a carpet in so he can take his friends up when he has them come) i want you Walt to send me a little change this week as you have done heretofore and when i get to hansHan's i wish you would send me five or six dollars at different times about two dollars at a time i may want to get some little things for her i believe i have said all i want too to i have heard nothing from poor Jess and as to AndrewsAndrew's children Jimmy brings them up here sometimes poor little objects of misery they live i give them things when they come

postscript.p: those criticisms on the press are all right
